➢ Networked Trade Platform (NTP) 
Java Developer | Jul 2017 – May 2019 
• Worked on the development of the NTP which is designed to be a trade
and logistics IT ecosystem connecting businesses, community systems and
platforms with Singapore Customs. 
• Worked on Revenue Management System (RMS) which manages the
revenue for Singapore Customs from all the other modules 
• Developed the backend of NTP using Spring framework with Maven tools
and Hibernate which is using restful web services to communicate between
different modules 

Page 1 of 2

 

 

 

• NTP used microservices architectural style making the services find-grained
and protocols light-weight 
• Managing APIs, relational database (Oracle Sql Developer) and Weblogic
application server 
• Developed proof-of-concepts related to custom error handling in Java and
cross-module API calls across Layer 7 API manager 
• Develops robust spring batch applications to serve the operations 
• Developed proof-of-concepts on Spring batch applications to use multiple
cross module jars, where every jar connects to different data source which
used across NTP 

➢ CPF Board Beacon 
Java Developer | May 2017 – Present 
• Works on the modernisation of Central Provident Fund Board Beacon Batch
Framework using Spring Batch Framework 
• Works on batch applications which mainly focus on withdrawals and monthly
payouts having an input data volume of approximately two million records 
• Beacon batch jobs use IBM Mainframe to trigger the batch jobs using JCLs
and the jobs itself runs on IB CICS and has a type 2 connection with IBM DB2  
• Developed batch jobs which is highly inetractive with COBOL utilities running
in IBM Mainframe

Chetan Jhaveri
Director at Visa
San Francisco Bay Area

Summary
Engineering leader with strong track record of accomplishment in
leading and delivering complex, scalable projects from concept
to production. Expert in translating business requirements into
technical, delivering on time and on budget. Highly effective team
leader with excellent organization and communication skills.

Experience

Visa
8 years 5 months
Director Of Engineering
December 2018 - Present (2 years 4 months)
Foster City, California, United States

Leading a technical team with a total strength of 10 engineers to maintain,
iteratively improve provisioning of tokens using the Visa Token Services
platform. Manage a backlog of Product feature and technical improvements in
an Agile development process. Provide analysis on monthly reporting of client
system usage, growth trends, sprint outputs.
• Provide technical vision, engaging product owners in understanding the
requirements and architecture to build out enhancements and new features to
existing product.
• Collaborated with PMO, Security, Performance to plan releases that meet
Visa’s security, availability and reliability standards.
• Instantiated a strong culture of engineering by reviewing developer’s design
documents and tester’s test strategy documents with a strong focus on
scalability, automation and security.
• Hired and mentored new college grads to be productive and strong
contributors expediting feature delivery.
• Partnered with Production engineering and client integration teams to
introduce support procedures for new features and ensure successful rollout
into Production.
• Built Splunk dashboards for all services, reporting availability, application
metrics to automate reporting for further analysis.

Page 1 of 4

 

 

 

Lead Software Engineer
April 2015 - November 2018 (3 years 8 months)
Foster City, CA

Lead development of REST services that provision credit card data into
HCE based digital wallets such as Android Pay, Samsung Pay. Integrated
several complex internal Visa services and Issuers to deliver tokens and card
personalization data. Support several cryptography standards to build a secure
solution that protected payment credentials end to end.
• Successfully delivered projects including Push provisioning, Secure element
provisioning, Payment Instrument transaction history, Sandbox support Visa
developer platform. These features enabled Visa to stay current with Wallets
and also is able to set the standard through Global Platform and EMVCo.
• Lead development effort of making the Services active in multi datacenters
across the refactored services to have datacenter affinity to increase available
capacity by 2x and have automatic disaster recovery.
• Enforced test coverages (unit tests, integration tests) to cover happy paths,
negative and race condition testing which lead to a predictable system
behavior and decreased sprint bug counts by 50%.
• Initiated an effort to address performance issues to achieve a high TPS
benchmark by optimizing queries, simplifying business logic and constant
monitoring of performance bottlenecks.
• Won 2nd place in the Visa 2018 Hackathon in the Next Gen Payment theme.

Staff Software Engineer
November 2012 - March 2015 (2 years 5 months)
Foster City, CA

Engineer in Team that worked in multiple domains. Responsibilities included:
• Built Rest based web services to store and manage checkout intents.
• Lead v1 migration project into the next generation v2 platform.
